metadata.title: CVE-2024-35919 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:mediatek: vcodec: adding lock to protect encoder context list Add a lockfor the ctx_list, to avoid accessing a NULL pointer within the'vpu_enc_ipi_handler' function when the ctx_list has been deleted due to anunexpected behavior on the SCP IP block.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
